FuncDef:
The ingress-lsp protect-mode bgp-frr command enables the BGP LSP FRR protection mode on the ingress.
The undo ingress-lsp protect-mode command disables the BGP LSP FRR protection mode on the ingress.
By default, BGP LSP FRR protection is disabled on the ingress.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In a seamless MPLS scenario, to improve service reliability, configure BGP FRR on the ingress of a BGP LSP and then run the bestroute nexthop-resolved tunnel and ingress-lsp protect-mode bgp-frr commands, implementing BGP LSP FRR protection. If the primary BGP LSP fails, services can be quickly switched to the backup BGP LSP, minimizing the duration of traffic interruption.
Prerequisites
Before configuring the BGP Auto FRR protection mode, configure BGP Auto FRR.
Configuration Impact
If the ingress-lsp trigger command is run more than once, the latest configuration overrides the previous one.
Precautions
It is recommended that the selection of labeled BGP IPv4 routes be based on the bestroute nexthop-resolved command.
